text: In 1889, the Old Catholic Church seceded from the Roman Catholic Church, mainly because Old Catholics do not accept the dogma that the pope is infallible. All of the Old Catholic Churches united in what is called the Union of Utrecht, in 1889. Category:19th century in the Netherlands Category:Christianity in the Netherlands Category:Old Catholicism Category:Utrecht (city) Category:Organizations based in the Netherlands Category:1889 establishments in Europe
title: Union of Utrecht (Old Catholic)
